intro: Aneilema sclerocarpum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming dense clusters of foliage. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
